intro: Decaneurum courtallense, commonly known as the Courtallense spurge, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
